subject: resource/Thomas_Lough
object: The Rt. Hon. Thomas Lough, P.C. (1850 – 11 January 1922), was a British radical Liberal politician.He was born in Cavan, Ireland to Mathew Lough and Martha Steel, and was educated at the Royal School Cavan and at Wesleyan Connexional School, Dublin.He worked as a tea merchant in London from 1880. He was an unsuccessful Liberal candidate for Truro at the 1886 general election and in 1888 appointed Ramsay MacDonald as a private secretary.
human_readable: The comment about Thomas Lough is: The Rt. Hon. Thomas Lough, P.C. He was an unsuccessful Liberal candidate for Truro at the 1886 general election and in 1888 appointed Ramsay MacDonald as a private secretary.
